body:
The string *does* contain markup, that is the point. So I want it to be rendered by the browser as markup - not encoded. Hence, it is held in a SafeBuffer.

Consider a model attribute that contains an announcement message, authored by trusted site admins, that includes HTML. When you display that message in the view, you want it to pass through as-is, no encoding. You indicate that preference by returning it in a SafeBuffer.
However, if you go to edit that message using something like:

    form.text_field, :announcement

It will create a corrupted `<input>` tag because any double quotes (used to delimit attributes in the user-supplied markup) will close the `value` attribute.
